title: 107_s1129
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so we will summarize the curr_chunk directly:

"PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH." "PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. Executive Schedule Pay Rates amended to adjust annual pay based on General Schedule employees' comparability payments in the District of Columbia." The text chunk discusses adjustments to annual pay rates for certain positions within the Executive Branch based on General Schedule employees' comparability payments in the District of Columbia. It also mentions amendments to the pay rates for Contract Appeals Board members in Title 5 of the United States Code. The text chunk outlines adjustments to pay rates for Contract Appeals Board members in Title 5 of the United States Code, based on General Schedule employees' comparability payments in the District of Columbia. Amendments are made to ensure that the rates of basic pay for board members are no less than a specified percentage of the rate under paragraph (1). Amendments are made to sections in Title 5 of the United States Code to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. Amendments are made to Title 5 of the United States Code to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. This includes substituting the annual rate of salary of the Vice President for the annual rate of basic pay payable for level I of the Executive Schedule and changing references to level IV to level III in various sections. Amendments are made to Title 5 of the United States Code to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. This includes changes to offices and positions within the judicial branch. Amendments are made to Title 5 of the United States Code to exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. This includes changes to positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, United States Code, circuit executives, and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. Amendments to Title 28 of the United States Code include changing levels from V to IV and IV to III, as well as adjusting the salary of the Director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts from "district" to "circuit". The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
